callOfDuty

Class Base

  • java.lang.Object
    • callOfDuty.Base

  • public class Base
extends java.lang.Object
    This contains a 10x10 array of Targets, representing a “base”, and some methods to manipulate it. Think of it as the map in this game.

      Base()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Base

        public Base()
        Creates an 10x10 ”empty” Base (and fills the Targets array with Ground objects). You could create a private helper method to do this. Also initializes any game variables, such as how many shots have been fired.

    • Method Detail

      • placeAllTargetRandomly

        public void placeAllTargetRandomly()
        Initializing all targets place all target randomly using placeTargetRandomly function for each target

      • win

        public boolean win()
        check if all targets are destroyed
        Returns:
        true if user wins

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints the Base. To aid the user, row numbers should be displayed along the left edge of the array, and column numbers should be displayed along the top. Numbers should be (0 to 9), not 1 to 10. “O” (capital letter O): Used to indicate a location that you have fired upon and hit a target “-”: Use ‘-’ to indicate a location that you have fired upon and found nothing there “X” (capital letter X): Use ‘X’ to indicate a location containing a destroyed Target. ‘.’: Use ‘.’ (a period) to indicate a location that you have never fired upon “T”: Used to indicate an undestroyed but hit Tank
